data.title: All 50 Krista Allen Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Get ready to dive into the world of Krista Allen, an actress who has captivated audiences with her impressive performances in a variety of films. In this roundup, we’ll be exploring her illustrious…
data.text:
Get ready to dive into the world of Krista Allen, an actress who has captivated audiences with her impressive performances in a variety of films. In this roundup, we’ll be exploring her illustrious career and some of her most memorable movie roles. Whether you’re a fan or just discovering her work, this article promises to provide an engaging and informative journey through the Krista Allen filmography.

As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.

1. Emmanuelle: A Time to Dream (1994)

Emmanuelle: A Time to Dream, “ the fifth installment of the Emmanuelle in Space series, is a steamy, romantic sci-fi adventure that explores the complexities of sexuality and human connection. In this gripping 1994 television film, the titular character, played by Krista Allen, continues her enlightening journey on the subject and guides the crew throughout the globe. Director David Cove blends captivating storytelling with striking visuals to create an immersive and enticing cinematic experience.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

2. Emmanuelle: First Contact (1994)

Dive into the world of Emmanuelle in “Emmanuelle: First Contact, “ a 1994 sci-fi comedy romance where love and passion are interstellar adventures. Journey with our heroine, the most sensual woman on Earth, as she makes first contact with a group of intergalactic travelers. Their mission? To learn about human love and desire. Who better to guide them than Emmanuelle?

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

3. Emmanuelle: One Final Fling (1994)

Emmanuelle: One Final Fling” takes viewers on an adventure through the steamy depths of the Amazon. Starring Krista Allen, this French romance film follows the titular character as she joins a fashion shoot crew aboard a boat. As they journey through the jungle, Emmanuelle uncovers a shocking secret — the Captain of the boat is a notorious jewel thief.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. Emmanuelle: A Lesson in Love (1994)

Emmanuelle: A Lesson in Love, directed by David Cove, is a fascinating romantic sci-fi film that delves into the depths of earthly desires and love. Released in 1994, the movie follows Emmanuelle as she takes Tasha, a young and innocent member of the spaceship crew, under her wing and teaches her about the pleasures and complexities of love. The narrative is filled with intricate moments of human-alien interaction, sensual scenes, and lesbian love scenes that blur the line between what is expected and forbidden.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

5. Emmanuelle: The Meaning of Love (1994)

Experience the captivating world of Emmanuelle in “Emmanuelle: The Meaning of Love” (1994). This intriguing film takes the audience on a journey as Emmanuelle — a professional with a unique approach to therapy — runs a clinic that uses sexual memories and VR computer simulations to help clients achieve sexual ecstasy and heal from past traumas.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

6. Emmanuelle: A World of Desire (1994)

Emmanuelle: A World of Desire, released in 1994, is a steamy sci-fi drama that takes the audience on an erotic adventure into space. The movie’s titular character, Emmanuelle, is a seductive and alluring woman who embarks on a mission to teach a group of space travelers the art of human sensuality from across the globe.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. Raven (1996)

Raven” (1996) follows a formidable criminal who becomes the target of the elite Raven Special Forces team, who must capture him when things go wrong on a mission to retrieve stolen military equipment. This action-packed thriller, directed by Russell Solberg and written by Jacobsen Hart, boasts a star-studded cast including Burt Reynolds, Matt Battaglia, and Krista Allen.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. Liar Liar (1997)

Liar Liar” is a hilarious 1997 comedy-fantasy film that explores the challenges of dishonesty and the consequences of speaking the truth. Directed by Tom Shadyac and written by Paul Guay and Stephen Mazur, this film stars Jim Carrey, Maura Tierney, and Amanda Donohoe. It is a lighthearted and inventive story that follows the life of a pathological liar who practices law in Los Angeles, California. The film revolves around a birthday wish that causes the protagonist to lose the ability to lie for a full 24 hours. This unexpected twist takes the character’s career on an unexpected upheaval filled with numerous comedic moments.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

11. The Haunted Sea (1997)

The Haunted Sea” (1997) is a chilling action-horror film set at sea where a group of adventurers aboard a mysterious ship uncover a centuries-old treasure trove of Aztec artifacts. The treasure’s guardian, a deadly creature, ensnares the crew in a nightmarish battle of greed, paranoia, and fear. As the crew races against time to escape, they must confront their deepest fears and desires in this suspense-filled tale.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

12. Avalon: Beyond the Abyss (1999)

In the heart-pounding sci-fi thriller “Avalon: Beyond the Abyss, “ a mysterious island explosion unleashes a horrifying black poison into the ocean, threatening to contaminate the earth and trigger a mass extinction. A team of underwater specialists, armed with cutting-edge equipment, embarks on a race against time to stop the catastrophe. But as they delve deeper into the mystery, they discover a series of bizarre and sinister twists that challenge their understanding of reality.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

13. Sunset Strip (2000)

Sunset Strip (2000) is a comically charming film set in 1972, taking place over the course of a day in the bustling Sunset Strip, Hollywood, California. This unforgettable tale of rock ’n’ roll, friendship, and self-discovery explores the lives of several unique individuals as they navigate through the ups and downs of life in Los Angeles.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

14. Face Value (2001)

In the thrilling drama “Face Value” (2001), a young man takes a daring leap into the unknown when he decides to help out his old friend by assuming his identity for a short stint in the fast-paced, glamorous world of his busy and mysterious pal. However, things quickly take a dark turn when he finds himself pursued relentlessly by a ruthless group of drug dealers, led by a deadly hitman.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

15. Totally Blonde (2001)

Totally Blonde is a light-hearted comedy that follows the journey of Meg Peters as she struggles to find the perfect partner. With a spontaneous decision, Meg bleaches her hair blonde, igniting a whirlwind of fun and laughter. The film explores the age-old question: “Do blondes really have more fun? “

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

16. Confessions of a Dangerous Mind (2002)

Confessions of a Dangerous Mind” is a thrilling, dark comedy film that retells the fascinating life of Chuck Barris, a well-known game show impresario whose memoir claimed he had been a CIA hitman. Directed by George Clooney, this cinematic experience stars Sam Rockwell as Chuck Barris, Drew Barrymore as Patricia Watson, and George Clooney himself in a small but significant role.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

17. Anger Management (2003)

In “Anger Management” (2003), a comedy film directed by Peter Segal and with a runtime of 1h 46min, we follow the life of Dave Buznik, a businessman who finds himself in an unexpected predicament when he is wrongfully sentenced to an anger management program. As he navigates the course, he meets Frank Sinatra Jr. , a renowned instructor who proves to be as aggressive as the participants in the program.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

18. Paycheck (2003)

Paycheck, “ an intriguing science-fiction action movie, sees protagonist Michael Jennings (Ben Affleck), a brilliant engineer, enticed with a lucrative job offer. The catch? He has to forget everything about it after completion. With an eye-opening discovery that could change the world, he is suddenly a wanted man with sinister forces pursuing him for his ability to see the future.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

19. Tony & Tina’s Wedding (2004)

Tony & Tina’s Wedding” is a hilarious and immersive comedy about two Italian families from contrasting backgrounds. Set against the backdrop of an Italian-American marriage ceremony, this film takes viewers on a rollercoaster ride through the joyous chaos of a wedding and reception. As improvisational comedy, the movie presents unexpected twists and turns as the story unfolds, with each event promising to be both entertaining and unpredictable.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

21. Meet Market (2004)

Meet Market, also known as A Guy Wears Eyeglasses, is a hilarious, steamy rom-com set amongst the bustling singles of Los Angeles in 2004. The film’s opening scene reveals a motley crew of characters, each trying to find love in the unlikeliest of places — the local grocery store.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

23. The Third Nail (2007)

The Third Nail is a gripping crime drama that follows the journey of a man who has been wrongfully convicted and eventually proven innocent. However, as he discovers that true justice extends beyond the law, his life takes a dark turn when his daughter is abducted.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

26. Silent Venom (2009)

Silent Venom” is a thrilling action-comedy film that takes place in the dangerous waters near a deserted island. When two scientists bring venomous snakes on board an American submarine, the crew is put in even more danger. The submarine must navigate the treacherous waters while the crew faces deadly encounters with the venomous snakes.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

27. Amazing Racer (2009)

Shannon’s Rainbow, “ a heartwarming family drama from 2009, follows the journey of a young girl named Shannon who, after the loss of her father, unexpectedly discovers the mother she never knew. As she decides to embark on a life-changing journey to meet her, she forms an unlikely bond with a compassionate horse trainer, leading them both on a path of adventure, growth, and ultimately, happiness. Together, they not only triumph in horse races but also forge new friendships that guide them through life’s many challenges.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

28. Held Up (2010)

Held Up” is a wild and wacky comedy that takes bank robbers to a whole new level. In this rollercoaster ride of a movie, two teams of crazed bank robbers hold a bank teller hostage, leading to a hilarious situation that keeps audiences on their toes. With a star-studded cast and fast-paced action, “Held Up” is sure to make you laugh and gasp in equal measure.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

29. Jesse Stone: No Remorse (2010)

Police Chief Jesse Stone returns in “Jesse Stone: No Remorse, “ a gripping crime drama set in the picturesque town of Paradise. When Jesse is temporarily suspended from his duties, he takes on a new role assisting in a high-profile serial killer case in Boston. As Jesse navigates this intense investigation, he struggles to leave his past behind and avoid the relentless calls from his ex.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

30. Black Widow (2010)

In “Black Widow, “ wealthy entrepreneur Sean McMurphy finds himself caught in a web of lies, deceit, and danger when he falls in love with a mysterious and seductive woman. As the passion between them grows, so does a web of darkness that ensnares everyone around them, drawing them deeper into a world of torture and manipulation. As Sean fights to uncover the truth, he must confront the twisted desires of his lover and the dark secrets that she keeps hidden.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

31. Little Women, Big Cars 2 (2012)

Little Women, Big Cars 2" is a delightful comedy that delves into the lives of four suburban soccer moms as they navigate the challenges of parenthood, marriage, and juggling their busy schedules. This humorous film follows the adventures of these friends as they strive to maintain their sanity while ensuring their children make it to soccer practice on time.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

32. Little Women, Big Cars (2012)

Little Women, Big Cars is a refreshing comedy-drama that follows four dynamic soccer moms as they navigate the chaos of their busy lives. With four compelling female protagonists — Meg, Barbara, Rocky, and Connie — this film explores the challenges and joys of motherhood, relationships, and personal growth. With humor and heart, the moms embark on a journey to support each other and find balance in their fast-paced world.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

34. Fatal Instinct (2014)

Fatal Instinct, released in 2014, is an action-packed thriller that will keep you on the edge of your seat. The story follows a dedicated police detective as he uncovers a seemingly unrelated string of evidence that appears to lead back to his long-imprisoned former partner’s ex-con brother — someone he personally helped put behind bars years prior.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

35. Spare Change (2015)

Spare Change” is a delightful, light-hearted comedy film released in 2015. Director duo Arturo Guzman and Jonathan Talbert bring to life the story of two best friends, Jane and Lily, who come up with an inventive plan to pretend to be homeless in order to find creative ways to get money from strangers. The film centers around the dilemma of these girls, as the line between their jobs and everyday life starts to blur.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

36. Rodeo & Juliet (2015)

Rodeo & Juliet” is a heartwarming family drama set during the Christmas season, combining the thrill of horseback riding, the joy of rediscovering love, and the beauty of the American countryside. When a big-city girl moves to a small rural town with her mother, they both embark on a journey of self-discovery and new beginnings.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

37. This Is Meg (2017)

This Is Meg” takes audiences on a riveting journey into the life of an up-and-coming female actress and comedienne living in Los Angeles. When the social media storm forces her to adapt her lifestyle, she learns that there’s more to life than just fame and glory. This funny, heartwarming comedy-drama is based on real events and promises to keep you entertained from start to finish.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

38. Eleven Eleven (2018)

Eleven Eleven” is a quirky, comedy-driven film that follows the journey of an obsessive UFO fanatic who risks his family to fulfill his lifelong dream of being abducted. Filled with intriguing characters and fascinating twists, the movie showcases the lengths one man will go for a seemingly impossible dream.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

39. The Perfect Mother (2018)

In “The Perfect Mother, “ Stella Marshall, a successful mother-daughter vlogger, finds her perfect world disrupted when her rebellious 16-year-old daughter, Shay, distances herself from her. Stella’s life takes a dark turn when she attracts the attention of a teenage fan, Peyton, who will do anything to make Stella her own perfect mother.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

40. Party Mom (2018)

Party Mom” takes audiences on a thrilling journey where everything seems like fun and games until it turns deadly. The film follows a mom, portrayed by Krista Allen, who throws an extravagant party at her luxurious mansion to celebrate her teenager daughter’s birthday. However, the night takes a dark turn when one of the guests ends up dead, and the mom finds herself in the midst of a crime investigation.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

41. Best Mom (2018)

In “Best Mom” (2018), a writer mom eagerly seeks a connection with her precocious daughter and, in an attempt to understand the art of listening and playing, joins an unscripted improv class. As she navigates the realm of improv, she discovers that both improv and motherhood are art forms that embrace failures. This heartwarming and lighthearted comedy, directed by Kuang Lee and written by Meg Weidner, features a talented cast including Krista Allen, Donna Mills, and Jilon VanOver.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

42. I Almost Married a Serial Killer (2019)

I Almost Married a Serial Killer is a chilling and suspenseful thriller that delves into the dark depths of deceit and danger. A single mom, played by Krista Allen, becomes a prime target for a notorious serial killer, causing her to enter the witness protection program with her daughter. However, the seemingly safe environment she and her daughter are placed in becomes a twisted game of cat and mouse, as they find themselves in grave danger once again.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

46. The Wrong Stepfather (2020)

The Wrong Stepfather” is a chilling thriller from 2020 that will keep you glued to your seat. A happy engagement to a charming college advisor abruptly takes a dark turn when a concerned mother fears that her fiancé may not be the best stepfather for her daughter.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

47. The Wrong Mr. Right (2021)

The Wrong Mr. Right” is a tense thriller that follows Jessica’s journey to uncover the dark truth about her mother’s new boyfriend, Paul. Returning home from college, Jess finds herself moving back in with her mother Tracy, and her life takes an unexpected turn when Paul makes his presence known in their household. Suspicion quickly grows within Jessica, leading her down a dangerous path as she works to prove that this seemingly charming man may not be who he claims to be.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

48. After Masks (2021)

After Masks” is an insightful drama film that explores the human experience during the pandemic. Through an anthology format, the movie delves into the challenges faced by individuals and society as a whole. The narrative incorporates references to video conferencing and TikTok, offering a contemporary take on the situation.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

49. Paradise Cove (2021)

Paradise Cove, “ a 2021 thriller directed by Martin Guigui, follows the story of a contractor and his wife who move to Malibu to flip his mother’s beach house. However, their dream home quickly becomes a nightmarish reality when they encounter a dangerously obsessed homeless woman living beneath their house.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

50. Shadows (2022)

Shadows, “ a gripping crime thriller set in 2022, follows the life of a young low-level drug dealer who is abruptly thrown into the middle of a dangerous web when a vicious drug kingpin puts a hit on him. His only hope for survival lies with his estranged mother and uncle, who step in to shield him from the imminent danger.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art
